data.title: Include dates in crash/sync log filenames.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This builds on #11985/#12056 by giving the sync and exception logs unique filenames.  This makes it easier to identify and grab older logs, with the tradeoff of making the logs dir more cluttered for people like ourselves who regularly crash the game.

This also fixes a regression from #4138, which broke the GameUID written to the syncreports.  If the log renames are controversial then we should at least take this fix.

data.title: Clean up ClientPings when a player drops from the server.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #12072.

The easiest way to test this is to add `System.Console.WriteLine(order.TargetString);` to the top of `UnitOrders.ProcessOrder` and then join/disconnect from a server a few times.  Before the fix you'll see all the orphaned ping objects be sent to your client.  After the fix you won't.

data.title: Read data from *all* connections to the server.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #10094 ðŸŽ‰ 

This was a really dumb one: the server would ignore all of the "normal" connections if there were any connections waiting in the handshaking (PreConns) list.  If a connection died before completing the handshake, then that would permanently lock the server for everyone else.

This doesn't try to clean up any dead connections in the PreConns list: they will be thrown out when the game switches to the playing state.

Ask on IRC if you want steps to easily trigger the grey-ping issue.  I'm not going to announce them here because they could be used maliciously.

data.title: Change Game.RunTime to a long to prevent overflow

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #12073.

Just changed Game.RunTime to a long and kept going until the compiler stopped yelling.

data.title: Game.Runtime overflows impact dedicated servers.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
The Game.Runtime counter overflows every ~25 days.  We use this on dedicated servers for at least the player pinger logic, and from this I can see several active servers that currently have negative ping times.

I suspect this may contribute towards our grey ping server issues, but I haven't yet found a direct link.

If we change Game.Runtime from an int to a long we push this problem from ~25 days out to ~300 million years, which should be more than enough for our purposes.

data.title: Client ping state gets out of sync when a player drops.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
We aren't removing the ClientPing from `LobbyInfo.ClientPings` when a player is dropped from the server.  This is especially visible on the "grey ping" servers, where you get sent many hundreds of bogus ping objects (one for each player who has tried to connect to the server) on join.

This doesn't seem to be a direct cause of the grey ping bugs, but it certainly doesn't help matters.

data.title: Fix beacons not being cancelable

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: Seems like this was forgotten about in #11862 (see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11862/commits/b016638ebe660039715829e9440ba711ca6f5fa5#diff-fd2e4668dd26cbdec352134907a49ceeL21).

data.title: Render WithDecoration above shroud
data.body:
Fixes #12058.

It also looked to me like using `SpriteRenderable.None` is better for performance than using `Enumerable.Empty<IRenderable>()`. (Is that correct?)

EDIT: Removed the `SpriteRenderable.None` change.

- secondary beam for glow effect
- disable (visual) target-tracking
- support for inaccuracy
- support for blockability

I have some more, but I'll leave that for a follow-up.

data.title: Add UnknownProgrammer to AUTHORS

data.title: server: Fix server getting wedged after map query with bad minimap

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
If the mapserver returned an unusable minimap blob, we'd end up dropping
the resulting exceptions on the floor, and committing a completely broken
MapPreview, which would then blow up the tail end of the map change
process, and all future ValidateClient calls after players join (which
itself was handled by kicking the player and logging some noise of dubious
value).

Adjusts exception handling in a number of places to log the exception
rather than dropping it on the floor, and makes the mapserver response
parsing tolerant of bogus minimap blobs -- in this case, we'd rather just
have no minimap.

Candidate for stable, as it fixes a bug present in the current release and
the current playtest series.

Signed-off-by: Chris Forbes chrisf@ijw.co.nz

data.title: Idle AI ore trucks
data.body: I've noticed several times that AI players will become completely ineffective after ore trucks stop harvesting. No amount of poking or prodding will help them "get with the program." Sometimes this is drawn by scarcity of resource, but then ore regenerates and the collection should be initiated again. Perhaps a backoff timer to scan for nearby ore in discovered/monitored map space instead of a complete idle scenario would be better? There is nothing less satisfying than defeating an AI that has incapacitated itself for minutes on end with a ton of nearby resources and no good reason. From my observations, it can happen with any AI style. Even more of an issue with allies who slowly let themselves be killed off. I've seen them stall out despite infusion with cash trucks just for fun.

data.title: Naval unit long-distance repair

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: Naval units will allow repair from arbitrary distance if a pathfinding route is not available back to the naval yard. Set several ships in a bay, blocking all routes of movement for a lead ship. Let the lead ship be damaged. Now select the lead ship and give it orders to return to the naval yard for repair. It will not move, but the repair will proceed without issue until complete. Applies at least to Allied ships. Unverified with Soviet ships. Current playtest.

data.title: Unable to join public and private servers - ArchLinux release-20160508
data.body:
When trying to join a public or a private server I never get fully  connected. I get to the lobby of the server but see none of the other players. Also the map screen keeps trying to download the map while the busy marker ticks back and forth, says the map is not available. This happens on any server I attempt to join.

OS: ArchLinux, latest as of 2016-09-19
Package installed is: openra-20160508-2

Have attempted to rename the game directory from my local user directory and start fresh, no change.

I am attaching a Wireshark dump performed during server join along with a screenshot of how far I get when joining a server. The screenshot is not from the attempt made during the Wireshark capture but has the exact same visual content (except for the IP address).

[openra-failed-server-join.pcapng.gz](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/479109/openra-failed-server-join.pcapng.gz)

![screenshot from 2016-09-19 01-04-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7715430/18620710/26133338-7e18-11e6-9bfb-0601d9cf9d65.png)
